results.title: The Voyageurs
results.brief_description: A film about the men who drove big freighter canoes into the wilderness in the days when the fur trade was Canada’s biggest business. The film recreates scenes of the early nineteenth century on the 5 000 km river trade route to the Athabasca. With songs by a male chorus, this film presents a tuneful view of history. The commentary is taken from journals of the time.

results.title: The Voyage of the Pacific peacemaker
results.brief_description: An intriguing look at a group of people who set out from Australia to sail first of all to Muroroa Atoll in the Pacific and then to the west coast of the USA to protest against the French tests in the Pacific and the deployment of the Trident nuclear submarines. Raises issues about the effectiveness of such protests, the motivations of the people involved and the differences of opinion of the people in the group. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Voyage of Odysseus
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of that part of Homer’s Odyssey dealing with the 10 year ordeal of returning home to Ithaca. Stylized visuals are used to recount the story of Odysseus and his companions as they experience the adventures and terrors of the epic journey, notably with the Cyclops, the Laestrygonians, Circe, the inhabitants of Hades, the Sirens, Scylla and Charybdis, Aeolus, Helios and the sacred cattle and Calypso. Narrated by Julie Harris. Models, sculpture and monster animation by John Matthews. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Voices of a string quartet
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Nina Collier, Arts and Audiences and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Introduces the instruments of the string quartet and indicates their similarities and differences. Presents selections in a variety of moods, including musical imitations of brasses, organ and harp. Performing artists: The Juilliard String Quartet.

results.title: The Voice of the people
results.creator_credit: Ian Allen, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the powerful influence of the television media and argues that it has the ability to misrepresent the opinions of the community through editorial licence. A man’s comments are edited so severely on the evening news that his viewpoint is totally misrepresented and his reaction is shown.

results.title: The Voice of Ivan Frost
results.creator_credit: Alanya Van De Wiel, Ann Shenfield, Paul Fletcher, Robert Stephenson and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: In a surreal industrial landscape populated by equally bizarre characters, the magical voice of celebrated singer Ivan Frost has the power to make people wish for death. In a remote village elsewhere, Alfonso Pellegrini, a shepherd with an astonishing musical talent, longs to leave his sheep and go in search of the fabulous sounds described in books. Being invited to play beside the remarkable singer, Alfonso is saddened to find himself thrust into the background, his precious violin broken from trying to compete for attention. Ivan’s world is similarly turned upside down when he awakens to find his voice gone and a scar across his chest. Without his legendary voice to bewitch the masses and open doors for him, he is forced to confront the nightmarish reality of his situation - alone.

results.brief_description: Introduces Highland music in its natural and historical environment. Shows the different types of this music and its impact on the music outside Scotland.

results.title: The Vital signs and their inter-relation: body temperature, pulse, respiration, blood pressure
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description:
A study of the physiology of the respiratory, heat regulatory, and circulatory systems, and their inter-relation in normal functioning, as well as in deviations from the normal. How to ascertain and record the vital signs, the importance of making thorough and accurate observations, and how to take care of the apparatus necessary for these observations, is demonstrated.
Designed for use in the instruction of professional nurses.

results.title: The Vital link
results.creator_credit: M.J. Clark, W. J. Allen and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description: Examines the development of transport routes, how the preferred means of transport is usually a compromise between convenience, speed and cost and some of the problems caused by an ever increasing dependence on transport in our everyday lives.
